desc: Longhouses was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

The longhouses, built right up against the castle's walls, are where the rank-and-file soldiers reside.
Here, you can also find places to repair armor and weapons and tailor clothes, among other things. Their simple exteriors belie the craftsmanship inside.
When it gets dark, the lights in this area create a captivating scene.
name: Longhouses<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Longhouses

desc: Rice Granary was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

This wooden granary is guarded day and night. It's the castle's most important grain storage.
The rice stored here not only fills the bellies of the inhabitants, but it also fills their hearts with relief.
name: Rice Granary<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Rice Granary

desc: Reservoir was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

Surrounded by the walls, the reservoir is the castle's primary source of fresh water.
You can see the reflection of nearby buildings and drifting clouds in its crystal-clear waters.
name: Reservoir<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Reservoir

desc: Front Gates was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

The entrance to the fantastical castle. Its high walls and thick, wooden doors bound in black steel serve as its first line of defense against invaders.
Atop the gates hangs a large bell, which rings out each night as a resounding call for the guards to remain vigilant.
name: Front Gates<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Front Gates

desc: Outer Citadel Entrance was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

One of several entryways into the outer citadel. Although not as majestic as the front gates, its elaborate construction gives it a striking presence of its own.
Come the twilight hours, the stone lanterns on both its sides come on one by one, gently illuminating passersby with warm light.
name: Outer Citadel Entrance<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Outer Citadel Entrance

desc: Residential Houses was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

Many of these houses built on the edge of the buffer zone are bungalows, though they have finer things like cherry trees and a small vegetable garden in the back yard.
When dusk falls over the castle, smoke from the furnaces and chatter from the windows leak out onto the streets.
name: Residential Houses<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Residential Houses

desc: Ancillary Tower was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

This tower, built in the outer citadel, isn't as large as the one in the inner citadel, but it still plays a role in the castle's administration.
Important records such as the castle's documents and confidential files are stored here, and only a select few are allowed to set foot inside.
name: Ancillary Tower<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Ancillary Tower

desc: Inner Citadel Bridge was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

The outer and inner citadels are connected by this critical bridge. Built of wood and stone and resting on heavy supports, it's strong enough to withstand a procession of horse-drawn carriages.
By night, moonlight bathes its surface as the calm waters around it murmur with tales of the castle's past.
name: Inner Citadel Bridge<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Inner Citadel Bridge
story: Repair Inner Citadel Bridge to Unlock

desc: Training Ground was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

The training ground rests in a quiet corner of the outer citadel, surrounded by cherry trees.
Buildings made in an old fashion are scattered around its gentle slope. Perhaps if you come here, you may have a chance encounter with someone.
name: Training Ground<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Training Ground

desc: Courtyard was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

Located in the outer citadel, this quiet courtyard strikes a wonderful balance between nature's beauty and man's craftsmanship.
Here, pink blossoms flutter in spring, greenery grows abundantly in summer, red and orange overflow in autumn, and snow-white branches speak of transience in winter. It is a canvas for the four seasons.
The passing wind stirs up ripples across the pond's surface, as does it unravel the tangled woes in one's heart.
name: Courtyard<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Courtyard

desc: Three-Storied Watchtower was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.
This solid watchtower, located near the wharf, stands at a strategic point overlooking both land and water.
name: Three-Storied Watchtower<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Three-Storied Watchtower

desc: Enclosure Entrance was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

The passageway to the eastern enclosure, a vital military area of the castle.
Though worn by time, its pillars still possess a simple, powerful grace in the sunlight.
name: Enclosure Entrance<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Enclosure Entrance

desc: Barracks was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

This is the barracks complex, where soldiers both live and refine their grasp on the art of combat.
Here, you'll find wooden stumps and bamboo swords for training, racks upon racks of bows, the ceaseless sounds of metal clashing with metal, and vitality in abundance.
name: Barracks<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Barracks
story: Tipsy Oni on a Sacred Night

desc: Armory was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

The armory isn't far from where the soldiers live. It's a robustly built structure with thick wooden walls.
Its interior is neatly lined with weapons and armor, and sometimes, you'll catch some guards enjoying a chat here while sharpening their blades.
name: Armory<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Armory

desc: Stables was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

Built on a plain in the eastern enclosure, the stables are where the castle's horses are bred and trained.
You can often see them on sunny days, grazing quietly in their paddocks, their coats gleaming in the sun.
name: Stables<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Stables

desc: Castle Tower was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

The main tower, a symbol of the castle's power and order, is where official affairs are tended to and orders are issued by the lord.
Ascend to its top floor and you can behold not just an unobscured view of the whole castle, but also see the mountains and blue waters that stretch on into the distance.
name: Castle Tower<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Castle Tower

desc: Castle Court was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

The luxurious court, located below the main tower, is home to the lord and the lord's relatives.
It boasts a regal exterior, while the interior is lavishly decorated with gold-leaf screens, lacquered furniture, and the works of master craftsmen, among other such extravagances.
name: Castle Court<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Castle Court
story: A Visitor in the Dead of Night

desc: Four-Storied Watchtower was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

This four-storied watchtower stands on the edge of the inner citadel, offering a wide field of view for defense and observation.
Its outer walls are reinforced with strong materials, and each floor has arrow slits and openings for firearms. It's a crucial structure in the castle's defense.
name: Four-Storied Watchtower<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Four-Storied Watchtower

desc: Inner Citadel Entrance was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

The connection between the inner and outer citadels.
Its tiles are inscribed with the lord's family crest, and the gate gives off a majestic impression.
name: Inner Citadel Entrance<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Inner Citadel Entrance

desc: Tea House was destroyed in the earthquake. Repair it to see details and increase <color=#d57676>Facility Damage</color> in Castle Defense.

A refined tea house built specifically for the lord. A faint smell wafts through its rooms, which are stocked with every tea utensil one could imagine.
It also has a small secret room that only the lord knows about. Behind the floral alcove in the east end of the house... that's where the fantastical treasure is.
name: Tea House<color=#d57676> (Destroyed)</color>
Tea House

desc: Recruitable: Warspite. Recruitment takes time; when completed, it increases <color=#d57676>Troop Damage</color> in Castle Defense.
Recruited: Warspite
name: Recruitable:Warspite
Warspite

desc: Recruitable: Brennus. Recruitment takes time; when completed, it increases <color=#d57676>Troop Damage</color> in Castle Defense.
Recruited: Brennus
name: Recruitable:Brennus
Brennus

desc: Recruitable: Laffey II. Recruitment takes time; when completed, it increases <color=#d57676>Troop Damage</color> in Castle Defense.
Recruited: Laffey II
name: Recruitable:Laffey II
Laffey II

desc: Recruitable: Gascogne. Recruitment takes time; when completed, it increases <color=#d57676>Troop Damage</color> in Castle Defense.
Recruited: Gascogne
name: Recruitable:Gascogne
Gascogne
